Course Description: THIS COURSE FOCUSES ON THE IMPORTANCE OF THE OPERATIONAL FUNCTIONS IN ORGANIZATIONS TODAY TO INCLUDE BUSINESS COMBINATIONS AND THE RELATED FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING TRANSACTIONS NECESSARY, SEGMENT REPORTING, OUTPUT PLANNING, INTERNATIONAL TRANSACTION ACCOUNTING, FOREIGN CURRENCY TRANSACTIONS, INVENTORY CONTROL, SCHEDULING, AND QUALITY CONTROL ARE FUNDAMENTAL ISSUES EXAMINED.  AN INTERWEAVING EMPHASIS WILL BE PLACED ON QUALITY AND ITS IMPACT IN SECURING A STRATEGIC ADVANTAGE FOR MANUFACTURING AND SERVICE ENTITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
ILLUSTRATE THE REASONS BUSINESS COMBINATIONS OCCUR AND  THE ACCOUNTING IMPLICATIONS OF SUCH TRANSACTIONS. 
CREATE JOURNAL ENTRIES NECESSARY FOR A GIVEN BUSINESS COMBINATION UNDER GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES. 
PREPARE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR A PARENT COMPANY AND SUBSIDIARY AS OF THE DATE OF A BUSINESS COMBINATION. 
PREPARE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ONE YEAR OR MORE FOLLOWING A BUSINESS COMBINATION, RECOGNIZING THE EFFECTS OF INTER-COMPANY TRANSACTIONS AND EVENTS. 
MEASURE AND RECORD EQUITY TRANSACTIONS BY A SUBSIDIARY OR OTHER INVESTEE COMPANY ON THE GENERAL LEDGER OF THE PARENT/INVESTOR CORPORATION. 
ANALYZE THE DEVELOPMENT OF INTERNATIONAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS AND THE IMPLICATIONS FOR U.S. CORPORATIONS. 
EXPLAIN THE BUSINESS PURPOSES OF DERIVATIVES AND HEDGING ACTIVITIES. 
MEASURE AND RECORD TRANSACTIONS DENOMINATED IN CURRENCIES OTHER THAN THE U.S. DOLLAR. 
CONVERT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES FROM A LOCAL CURRENCY TO THE U.S. DOLLAR, IN ACCORDANCE WITH U.S. GAAP. 
EXPLAIN THE REQUIREMENTS FOR INTERIM FINANCIAL REPORTING AND SEGMENT DISCLOSURES IN FINANCIAL REPORTS OF PUBLICLY-OWNED COMPANIES. 
IDENTIFY AND DISCUSS THE UNIQUE CHARACTERISTICS OF A PARTNERSHIP AND COMPARE AND CONTRAST IT WITH A CORPORATE ORGANIZATION.
Textbook(s): FISCHER, TAYLOR, AND CHENG (2006).  ADVANCED ACCOUNTING (9TH ED.).  THOMSON SOUTHWEST.  ISBN:  0324304013.
